sources.snippet_or_excerpt: By Naga Avan-Nomayo · Markets•December 18, 2025, 6:27AM EST. Share. 'On a knife's edge': Analysts say bitcoin faces rising downside bets amid year.
Crypto had a rough November. The pain is persisting into December — and that could signal trouble ahead for the stock market.

hypothesis_content.title: Asian Session Liquidity Gap Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: During Neutral/Bear regimes, exaggerated price moves (>1.8%) that occur during low-liquidity periods (01:00-04:00 UTC) have a >65% probability of partial retracement (50-70%) during the first 2 hours of the London open (07:00-09:00 UTC).
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low liquidity periods (Asian night) are prone to exaggerated, often unsustainable moves. The return of European institutional liquidity provides a natural counter-force, especially in uncertain, 'on edge' markets where directional conviction is low.
entry_conditions: BTC price move between 01:00-04:00 UTC exceeds +/-1.8% on 1-hour closing basis
True Range during the move is >150% of the prior 5-period average
Cumulative volume during move is <65% of the prior day's same-session volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 50% retracement of the initial 01:00-04:00 UTC move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends beyond the 01:00-04:00 UTC high/low by 0.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The retracement fails to reach 50% in >35% of signals, indicating either sustained directional pressure or a change in global liquidity patterns.
